description: Diminutive (by way of -rel) of Middle English gōme (“man, warrior, husband, male servant”), Old English guma (“male, hero”), from Proto-Germanic *gumô (“man, person”), from Proto-Indo-European *ǵʰmṓ (“man, person”). More at groom.

examples: [...] to the apparent delectation of immense audiences of gaping gomerals, but to the intense disgust of all sensible people.
